description: Concatenate exponents in prime factorization of n.
comments: a(n)=1 for prime n; a(n)=11,111,1111,... if n=product of two, three, four, ... distinct primes. - _Zak Seidov_, Dec 15 2006The sequence of (nonzero) exponents in the prime factorization of a number is called its prime signature. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 17 2008
links: Zak Seidov and Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (First 2000 terms from Zak Seidov)
prog: (PARI) A037916(n)=if( n>1, eval(concat(concat([""],factor(n)[,2]~)))) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 17 2008(PARI) primesig(n)=sum(i=1,#n=vecsort(factor(n)[,2]),10^(#n-i)*n[i]) \\ up to the order of digits, the same result up to 2^10. \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 17 2008
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
